8.3 Working with the Repository Script APIs - Reference Documentation

Authors: Microsoft Corporation

Version: 8.0.0

Table of Contents

8.1/r/repository/script/list
8.2/r/repository/script/execute
8.3/r/repository/script/render
8.4/r/repository/script/interrupt

8.3 Working with the Repository Script APIs

The Repository Script APIs provide some script-specific functionality for repository-managed scripts.

Scripts are blocks of R code with well-defined inputs and outputs. While scripts are technically also repository-managed files, scripts differ from other repository-managed files as they perform a very specific function that can be exposed as an executable on the API.

Important! Repository-managed scripts are files in the repository so all API calls described in the section Working with Repository Files are available to create and manage repository-managed scripts.

8.3.1 /r/repository/script/list

This call lists repository-managed scripts.

This call is available to authenticated and anonymous users. However, if the caller is an anonymous user then only published scripts will be returned in the response markup.

HTTP Method

GET

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format â€“ specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • filename - (optional) when specified, call returns list of script versions for filename
  • shared - (optional) if true, scripts shared by other users are included in the response markup
  • published - (optional) if true, scripts published by other users are included in the response markup
  • external - (optional) if true, this call returns scripts found in the external repository, otherwise returns scripts found in the default repository

Examples 

format=json
published=true

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/repository/script/list",
            "success": true,
            "repository": {
                "scripts": [
                    {
                        "filename": "demo.R",
                        "descr": "Sample R script.",
                        "author": "george",
                        "authors": [
                            "george"
                        ],
                        "version": null,
                        "versionmsg": null,
                        "latestby": "george",
                        "type": "text/plain",
                        "category": "script",
                        "tags": null,
                        "length": 6,
                        "md5": "77d7c62ca2bc4ac236235020fa3cb319",
                        "lastModified": 1378391625616,
                        "restricted": "MARKETING",
                        "shared": true,
                        "published": false,
                        "access": "Restricted",
                        "url": "http://dhost:dport/deployr/r/repository/
                        file/download/george/demo.R"
                    },
                    {
                        "filename": "sales.R",
                        "descr": "Sales analysis by region.",
                        "author": "susan",
                        "authors": [
                            "susan"
                        ],
                        "version": null,
                        "versionmsg": null,
                        "latestby": "susan",
                        "type": "text/plain",
                        "category": "script",
                        "tags": null,
                        "length": 674,
                        "md5": "50d7c62ca2bc4ac236235020fa3cb913",
                        "lastModified": 1378391625616,
                        "restricted": null,
                        "shared": false,
                        "published": true,
                        "access": "Public",
                        "url": "http://dhost:dport/deployr/r/repository/
                        file/download/susan/sales.R"
                    }
                ]
            },
            "httpcookie": "2E8E6E359A838FEA20A74CA65E10A031"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/repository/script/list</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <repository>
      <scripts>
        <script>
          <filename>demo.R</filename>
          <descr>Sample R script.</descr>
          <author>george</author>
          <authors>
            <author>george</author>
          </authors>
          <version/>
          <versionmsg/>
          <latestby>george</latestby>
          <type>text/plain</type>
          <category>script</category>
          <tags/>
          <length>6</length>
          <restricted>MARKETING</restricted>
          <shared>true</shared>
          <published/>
          <access>Restricted</access>
          <md5>77d7c62ca2bc4ac236235020fa3cb319</md5>
          <lastModified>1378391625616</lastModified>
          <url>http://dhost:dport/deployr/r/repository/
          file/download/george/demo.R</url>
        </script>
        <script>
          <filename>sales.R</filename>
          <descr>Sales analysis by region.</descr>
          <author>susan</author>
          <authors>
            <author>susan</author>
          </authors>
          <version/>
          <versionmsg/>
          <latestby>susan</latestby>
          <type>text/plain</type>
          <category>script</category>
          <tags/>
          <length>674</length>
          <restricted/>
          <shared/>
          <published>true</published>
          <access>Public</access>
          <md5>50d7c62ca2bc4ac236235020fa3cb913</md5>
          <lastModified>1378391625616</lastModified>
          <url>http://dhost:dport/deployr/r/repository/
          file/download/susan/demo.R</url>
        </script>
      </scripts>
    </repository>
    <httpcookie>2E8E6E359A838FEA20A74CA65E10A031</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

8.3.2 /r/repository/script/execute

This call executes repository-managed scripts or external scripts on an Anonymous Project.

To execute a single repository-managed script the caller must provide parameter values for filename , author and optionally version . To execute a chain of repository-managed scripts the caller must provide a comma-separated list of values on the filename , author and optionally version parameters.

To execute a single external script the caller must provide a valid URL or file path using the externalsource parameter. To execute a chain of external scripts the caller must provide a comma-separated list of values on the externalsource parameter. Note, to execute an external script the caller must have POWER_USER privileges so this feature is not available to anonymous users on this call.

Note: A chained execution executes each of the scripts identified on the call in a sequential fashion on the R session, with execution occuring in the order specified on the parameter list.

Please see the Standard Execution Model section in this guide for further details about the parameters on this call.

Some key data indicated in the response markup on this call:

  • console - indicates the R console output resulting from the execution
  • results - indicates the list of files generated by the R graphics device
  • artifacts - indicates the list of files generated or modified in the working directory
  • objects - indicates the list of R objects returned from the workspace
  • files - indicates the list of files and objects stored in the repository after the execution completes
  • interrupted - indicates the interrupted status of execution
  • error - on failure, indicates the reason for failure
  • errorCode - on failure, indicates the error code for failure

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format â€“ specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • filename â€“ (optional) comma-separated list of repository-managed script filenames
  • directory - (optional) comma-separated list of repository-managed directories for scripts, defaults to root
  • author â€“ (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per filename
  • version â€“ (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per filename
  • externalsource â€“ (optional) comma-separated list of URLs or file paths to external scripts

Pre-Execution Parameters

  • inputs - (optional) DeployR-encoded inputs
  • csvinputs - (optional) comma-separated list of primitive name/value inputs
  • preloadbydirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of repository directory names
  • preloadfilename - (optional) comma-separated list of repository filenames
  • preloadfiledirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per preloadfilename
  • preloadobjectname - (optional) comma-separated list of repository object (.rData) filenames
  • preloadobjectdirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per preloadobjectname
  • adoptworkspace â€“ _(optional) identifies project whose workspace is to be adopted
  • adoptdirectory â€“ _(optional) identifies project whose directory is to be adopted
  • adoptpackages â€“ _(optional) identifies project whose package dependencies are to be adopted
  • blackbox - (optional) if true, the execution will occur on the HTTP blackbox project for the current HTTP session
  • recycle - (optional) if true, recycles the R session associated with the HTTP blackbox project on the current HTTP session

On-Execution Parameters

  • cluster - (optional) specifies a grid node cluster for targeted execution
  • tag - (optional) specifies a tag that labels the execution
  • echooff - (optional) if true R commands will not appear in the console output
  • consoleoff - (optional) if true console output is not returned in the response markup
  • artifactsoff - (optional) when enabled, artfiacts generated in the working directory are neither cached to the database nor reported in the response markup
  • enableConsoleEvents - (optional) if true console events are delivered on the event stream
  • graphics - (optional) specifies preferred R graphics device for execution: png or svg
  • graphicswidth - (optional) specifies preferred width for R graphics device images
  • graphicsheight - (optional) specifies preferred height for R graphics device images

Post-Execution Parameters

  • robjects â€“ (optional) specifies a comma-separated list of objects for retrieval following the execution
  • storefile - (optional) comma-separated list of working directory filenames
  • storeobject - (optional) comma-separated list of workspace object names
  • storeworkspace - (optional) filename (.rData) where workspace contents will be saved in the repository
  • storedirectory - (optional) repository directory for stored files and objects after the execution completes, defaults to root
  • storenewversion - (optional) if true, ensures each file stored in repository results in new version being created if needed
  • storepublic - (optional) if true, publishes each file stored in the repository
  • infinity - (optional) specifies custom value for Infinity appearing in R object data returned on call, otherwise Infinity is represented by 0x7ff0000000000000L
  • nan - (optional) specifies custom value for NaN appearing in R object data returned on call, otherwise NaN is represented by null
  • encodeDataFramePrimitiveAsVector - (optional) if true, data.frame primitives are encoded vectors in R object data returned on call

Examples 

format=json
filename=Histogram of Auto Sales
author=testuser

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/repository/script/execute",
            "success": true
            "project": {
                "project": "STATELESS-a818abcc-82a5-4df5-8604-01da26f85188",
                "name": "Project: Autosaved",
                "author": "STATELESS",
                "authors": [
                    "STATELESS"
                ],
                "descr": "Autosaved by DeployR."
                "longdescr": null,
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378395562038,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original."
            },
            "interrupted": false,
            "execution": {
                "code": "# Create a vector of auto sales for each category
of vechicles. rn# The value contains the number of units sold each
weekday:rn# (i.e. 1 car sold on Monday, 3 cars sold on Tuesday...)rn
cars <- c(1, 3, 6, 4, 9)rntrucks <- c(2, 5, 4, 5, 12)rnsuvs <-
c(4,4,6,6,16)rn rn# Create a table from the vectors.rnautos_data
<- cbind(cars, trucks, suvs)rn rn# Show the the table.rn
print(autos_data)rn rn# Send the plot to a file called histogram.png.
rnpng("histogram.png")rn rn# Create a histogram of auto sales.
rnbarplot(as.matrix(autos_data), main="Autos", ylab= "Total",
beside=TRUE, col=rainbow(5))rn rn# Place the legend at the top-left
corner with no frame, using rainbow colors.rnlegend("topleft",
c("Mon","Tue","Wed","Thu","Fri"), cex=0.6, bty="n",
fill=rainbow(5))rn# Restore the plot device.rndev.off()rn",
                "resultsAvailable": 0,
                "actor": "anonymous",
                "tag": null,
                "interrupted": false,
                "timeStart": 1378316295608,
                "timeCode": 74
                "timeTotal": 373,
                "resultsGenerated": 0,
                "resultsAvailable": 0,
                "execution": "EXEC-38bc9824-9dc8-4d42-90d3-9cb5d9d366b1",
                "console": "n> # Create a vector of auto sales for each
category of vechicles. n> # The value contains the number of units sold
each weekday:n> # (i.e. 1 car sold on Monday, 3 cars sold on Tuesday...)n>
cars <- c(1, 3, 6, 4, 9)nn> trucks <- c(2, 5, 4, 5, 12)nn>
suvs <- c(4,4,6,6,16)nn> # Create a table from the vectors.n>
autos_data <- cbind(cars, trucks, suvs)nn> # Show the the table.n>
print(autos_data)n     cars trucks suvsn[1,]    1      2    4n[2,]
    3      5    4n[3,]    6      4    6n[4,]    4      5    6n
[5,]    9     12   16nn> # Send the plot to a file called histogram.png.
n> png("histogram.png")nn> # Create a histogram of auto sales.n>
barplot(as.matrix(autos_data), main="Autos", ylab= "Total",  beside=TRUE,
col=rainbow(5))nn> # Place the legend at the top-left corner with no frame,
using rainbow colors.n> legend("topleft", c("Mon","Tue","Wed",
"Thu","Fri"), cex=0.6, bty="n", fill=rainbow(5))nn> # Restore the plot
device.n> dev.off()npng n  2 n",
                "results": [],
                "artifacts": [
                    {
                        "filename": "histogram.png",
                        "descr": null,
                        "length": 7285,
                        "type": "image/png",
                        "category": "plot",
                        "project": "STATELESS-a818abcc-82a5-4df5-8604-01da26f85188",
                        "lastmodified": 1378395620000,
                        "url": "http://dhost:dport/deployr/r/repository/
                        script/directory/download/
                        STATELESS-a818abcc-82a5-4df5-8604-01da26f85188/histogram.png"
                    }
                ]
            },
                "warnings": [
                ]
            },
            "workspace": {
                "objects": []
            },
            "repository": {
                "files": []
            },
            "httpcookie": "6E458503AF44714A7DEFB07254F61A1C",
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/repository/script/execute</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>STATELESS-f3787a7d-f5ed-4020-bc24-d17ca211141e</project>
      <name>Project: Autosaved</name>
      <descr>Autosaved by DeployR.</descr>
      <shared/>
      <longdescr/>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
      <author>STATELESS</author>
      <authors>
        <author>STATELESS</author>
      </authors>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <lastmodified>1378395963176</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
    </project>
    <execution>
      <code><![CDATA[ # Create a vector of auto sales for each category of vechicles.
# The value contains the number of units sold each weekday:
# (i.e. 1 car sold on Monday, 3 cars sold on Tuesday...)

trucks <- c(2, 5, 4, 5, 12)
suvs <- c(4,4,6,6,16)

# Place the legend at the top-left corner with no frame, using rainbow colors.
legend("topleft", c("Mon","Tue","Wed","Thu","Fri"), cex=0.6, bty="n", fill=rainbow(5))
# Restore the plot device.
dev.off()
 ]]></code>
      <execution>EXEC-ee4d6644-db56-4ae6-b868-c9dd8b07dc89</execution>
      <actor>anonymous</actor>
      <tag/>
      <timeStart>1378395962484</timeStart>
      <timeCode>98</timeCode>
      <timeTotal>359</timeTotal>
      <resultsGenerated/>
      <resultsAvailable/>

8.3.3 /r/repository/script/render

This call executes repository-managed scripts or external scripts on an Anonymous Project and returns a simple HTML page that displays the results generated on the execution.

On a successful execution, the HTML page will display the following data when available on the response:

  • R console output
  • R workspace object data
  • R generated plots
  • Links to R working directory artifacts
  • Links to Repository stored artifacts

On a failed execution, the HTML page will display an error message indicating the cause of the failure and when available, R console output.

The API call makes it very simple to integrate outputs generated by DeployR-managed R scripts into any third-party application. It can also be used as a very simple test and debugging aid for R script and application developers.

To execute a single repository-managed script the caller must provide parameter values for filename , author and optionally version . To execute a chain of repository-managed scripts the caller must provide a comma-separated list of values on the filename , author and optionally version parameters.

To execute a single external script the caller must provide a valid URL or file path using the externalsource parameter. To execute a chain of external scripts the caller must provide a comma-separated list of values on the externalsource parameter. Note, to execute an external script the caller must have POWER_USER privileges so this feature is not available to anonymous users on this call.

Note: A chained execution executes each of the scripts identified on the call in a sequential fashion on the R session, with execution occuring in the order specified on the parameter list.

Please see the Standard Execution Model section in this guide for further details about the parameters on this call.

Some key data indicated in the response markup on this call:

  • console - indicates the R console output resulting from the execution
  • results - indicates the list of files generated by the R graphics device
  • artifacts - indicates the list of files generated or modified in the working directory
  • objects - indicates the list of R objects returned from the workspace
  • files - indicates the list of files and objects stored in the repository after the execution completes
  • interrupted - indicates the interrupted status of execution
  • error - on failure, indicates the reason for failure
  • errorCode - on failure, indicates the error code for failure

HTTP Method

GET

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format â€“ (optional) if the inputs parameter if non-null, format must specifies the markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project â€“ specifies the project identifier
  • filename â€“ (optional) comma-separated list of repository-managed script filenames
  • directory - (optional) comma-separated list of repository-managed directories for scripts, defaults to root
  • author â€“ (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per filename
  • version â€“ (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per filename
  • externalsource â€“ (optional) comma-separated list of URLs or file paths to external scripts

Pre-Execution Parameters

  • inputs - (optional) DeployR-encoded inputs
  • csvinputs - (optional) comma-separated list of primitive name/value inputs
  • preloadbydirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of repository directory names
  • preloadfilename - (optional) comma-separated list of repository filenames
  • preloadfiledirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per preloadfilename
  • preloadobjectname - (optional) comma-separated list of repository object (.rData) filenames
  • preloadobjectdirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per preloadobjectname
  • adoptworkspace â€“ _(optional) identifies project whose workspace is to be adopted
  • adoptdirectory â€“ _(optional) identifies project whose directory is to be adopted
  • adoptpackages â€“ _(optional) identifies project whose package dependencies are to be adopted
  • blackbox - (optional) if true, the execution will occur on the HTTP blackbox project for the current HTTP session
  • recycle - (optional) if true, recycles the R session associated with the HTTP blackbox project on the current HTTP session

On-Execution Parameters

  • cluster - (optional) specifies a grid node cluster for targeted execution
  • tag - (optional) specifies a tag that labels the execution
  • echooff - (optional) if true R commands will not appear in the console output
  • consoleoff - (optional) if true console output is not returned in the response markup
  • artifactsoff - (optional) when enabled, artfiacts generated in the working directory are neither cached to the database nor reported in the response markup
  • enableConsoleEvents - (optional) if true console events are delivered on the event stream
  • graphics - (optional) specifies preferred R graphics device for execution: png or svg
  • graphicswidth - (optional) specifies preferred width for R graphics device images
  • graphicsheight - (optional) specifies preferred height for R graphics device images

Post-Execution Parameters

  • robjects â€“ (optional) specifies a comma-separated list of objects for retrieval following the execution
  • storefile - (optional) comma-separated list of working directory filenames
  • storeobject - (optional) comma-separated list of workspace object names
  • storeworkspace - (optional) filename (.rData) where workspace contents will be saved in the repository
  • storenewversion - (optional) if true, ensures each file stored in repository results in new version being created if needed
  • storepublic - (optional) if true, publishes each file stored in the repository
  • infinity - (optional) specifies custom value for Infinity appearing in R object data returned on call, otherwise Infinity is represented by 0x7ff0000000000000L
  • nan - (optional) specifies custom value for NaN appearing in R object data returned on call, otherwise NaN is represented by null
  • encodeDataFramePrimitiveAsVector - (optional) if true, data.frame primitives are encoded vectors in R object data returned on call

Examples 

filename=Histogram of Auto Sales
author=testuser

Response

Content-Type: text/html

Sample Response

Sample Error Response

8.3.4 /r/repository/script/interrupt

This call interrupts the current execution on the HTTP Blackbox project associated with the current HTTP session.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format â€“ specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml

Examples 

format=json

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/repository/script/interrupt",
            "success": true,
            "interrupted": true,
            "httpcookie": "675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/repository/script/interrupt</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <interrupted>true</interrupted>
    <httpcookie>675987FAFA41B1F169CFC5AB3EC5F563</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>
